DGACM.relevance_comment: Mandates the Secretary‑General to notify Members at least 60 days in advance of the opening of a regular session. DGACM/Conference Management implements this Secretariat notification and session‑planning function (see PPB responsibilities for facilitating Assembly sessions and planning/coordination of conference services).

Requires the Secretary‑General to inform other Members immediately when a Member requests convening a special session. DGACM operationally supports such communications and the logistics of convening sessions as part of Secretariat conference‑servicing responsibilities.

Obliges the Secretary‑General to notify Members of special sessions (timing specified). This is an operational Secretariat duty carried out through conference‑management processes that DGACM provides (meeting scheduling/notifications in the PPB).

Directs that copies of the notice convening each session be addressed to other principal organs and specialized agencies. DGACM (Secretariat conference services) handles distribution of session notices and related outreach across UN organs as reflected in its conference‑management remit.

States that the provisional agenda for a regular session shall be drawn up by the Secretary‑General and communicated to Members at least sixty days before opening. DGACM provides the secretariat processes and publishing/distribution support for agendas and related documentation in its programme of work (agenda management and e‑services noted in the PPB).

Requires that supplementary items be placed on a supplementary list which shall be communicated to Members at least twenty days before opening. The communication and maintenance of agenda/supplementary lists are Secretariat tasks implemented through DGACM’s documentation and meeting‑planning functions.

Provides that the Secretary‑General shall act in that capacity at all meetings and may designate a member of the Secretariat to act in his place. This assigns meeting representation and delegation authority to Secretariat staff — functions that DGACM carries out in providing procedural and technical secretariat support to the Assembly and committees (PPB subprogramme responsibilities).

States that the Secretary‑General shall provide and direct the staff required by the General Assembly and any committees or subsidiary organs. DGACM is the Secretariat entity charged with provisioning and directing the conference‑servicing and documentation staff (explicitly reflected in the PPB programme responsibilities for staffing, temporary assistance and global capacity planning).

Explicit Secretariat duty: 'The Secretariat shall receive, translate, print and distribute documents, reports and resolutions ... interpret speeches ... prepare, print and circulate the records of the session ... distribute all documents ... and, generally, perform all other work which the Assembly may require.' This directly mandates the core activities that DGACM’s subprogrammes (documentation, meetings, publishing, interpretation, verbatim reporting and distribution) are established to implement in the PPB.

Provides that speeches in any of the six languages shall be interpreted into the other five languages. This creates an obligation for interpretation services that the Secretariat must provide — a direct operational mandate implemented by DGACM’s meetings/interpretation services (subprogramme 4 and related duty‑station activities in the PPB).

Requires that verbatim or summary records shall be drawn up as soon as possible in the languages of the General Assembly. The preparation and issuance of verbatim/summary records are Secretariat functions implemented by DGACM (verbatim reporting, records processing and publishing services reflected in the PPB).

Specifies that during sessions the Journal of the United Nations shall be published in the languages of the Assembly. Publication of the Journal is a Secretariat publishing responsibility — reflected in DGACM’s PPB activities (development and operation of the Journal and eJournal platforms).

States that all resolutions and other documents shall be published in the languages of the General Assembly. This imposes multilingual publishing and simultaneous‑issuance obligations that DGACM’s documentation and publishing subprogrammes are mandated and resourced to carry out in the PPB.

Rule 58(a): Verbatim records of the meetings of the General Assembly and the First Committee 'shall be drawn up by the Secretariat and submitted to those organs after approval by the presiding officer.' This is an explicit Secretariat mandate implemented operationally by DGACM’s verbatim reporting and records subprogramme.

Rule 58(b): Sound recordings of meetings 'shall be made by the Secretariat.' Provision and custody of sound recordings are Secretariat responsibilities that DGACM executes (recording/transcription and archival functions described in the PPB).

Requires that resolutions adopted by the General Assembly shall be communicated by the Secretary‑General to Members within fifteen days after the close of the session. The timely communication and distribution of adopted resolutions is an operational Secretariat task performed via DGACM’s documentation and publishing channels.
